summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 7 to August 10, 2019. It includes detailed medical encounter notes, physical exam results, vital signs, medication orders, and a transfer summary, documenting his health status and medical care while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. A series of Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering his medical intake, assessments, and treatments at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in July 2019, shortly before his death. The documents detail his medical history, physical exams, lab results, and prescribed medications. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 2019, detailing lab results, clinical encounters, and injury reports. It includes his refusal of an eye exam, reports of neuropathy, and a detailed account of an injury on July 23, 2019, where he was found with a rope around his neck in his cell, leading to a suicide watch placement. The records show he insinuated his cellmate was involved but refused to elaborate. This document contains Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including clinical encounter notes from July 2019 detailing his medical history, conditions, and treatment plans, as well as multiple forms where he refused specific medical evaluations. It provides a snapshot of his health status and interactions with BOP medical staff while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 10, 2019, to his death on August 10, 2019. It includes records of refused treatments, dental and chronic care evaluations, and a detailed resuscitation report from the day he was found unresponsive in his cell.

connections.description: Robert was the prescribing provider and cosigner for Epstein's medical encounter and medication orders on July 12, 2019.
Terrance (RN) provided patient education counseling to Epstein, as recorded in the assessments.
Joaquin, Y. MLP was involved in Epstein's medical assessment and documentation on July 9, 2019.
Maum, Cheryl generated Epstein's dental health history report on July 26, 2019.
Dental Assistant DeBruca documented a failed dental screening for Epstein on July 18, 2019.
Dale counseled Epstein on the consequences of refusing an eye doctor evaluation.
Joseph Columbo provided patient education to Epstein regarding his plan of care.
Epstein received a dental examination from Dr. C. Ancrum at the MCC New York facility.
Epstein was evaluated by Dr. Beaudoin during a chronic care clinic visit on July 30, 2019.
Epstein was evaluated by a Dr. Robert MD during chronic care clinic visits, as per medical records.

events.title: Initial Medical Encounter
events.description: Epstein underwent a comprehensive physical examination at the MCC health services, documenting his baseline health, including a history of constipation, and he was prescribed Bisacodyl.

events.title: Chronic Care Physician Evaluation
events.description: Epstein was evaluated for multiple chronic conditions including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, low back pain, and neuralgia. Medications including a Medrol dose pack and Magnesium Hydroxide were prescribed.

events.title: Medical Transfer Summary Prepared
events.description: A comprehensive medical transfer summary was generated, listing all of Epstein's active health problems, medications, and pending appointments, in preparation for a potential transfer.

events.title: Medical Intake Cosign
events.description: Initial medical intake and cosign encounter for Epstein at MCC New York, including orders for lab tests and a chest X-ray.

events.title: Comprehensive History & Physical
events.description: A detailed medical history and physical examination of Epstein, documenting his health status, vital signs, and medical history.

events.title: Medication Change Request
events.description: Epstein requested and was prescribed Colace (Docusate Sodium) instead of bisacodyl for constipation.

events.title: Failed Dental Screening
events.description: A dental screening appointment for Epstein was not completed because he was not escorted to the clinic despite several call-outs.

events.title: Dental Health Assessment
events.description: Epstein underwent a dental health history screen and A&O exam, revealing conditions like gingival recession and crowding.

events.title: Epstein Found with Rope Around Neck
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit 205 - Cell 124) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He reported waking up 'snorting' and had circular erythema on his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Eye Exam and Hints at Cellmate Involvement
events.description: Epstein refused an optometrist evaluation and signed a refusal form. In a follow-up visit, he insinuated his cellmate was involved in the neck injury event but refused to discuss details.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neuropathy Symptoms
events.description: Epstein reported follow-up for neuropathy, describing tingling and numbness in his right hand ('pins and needles') and a prior incident of losing control of his right arm upon waking.

events.title: Epstein's Lab Tests Collected
events.description: Blood and serology tests (including Hematology, Hemoglobin A1C, RPR, HIV) were collected from Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC New York facility.

events.title: Epstein Chronic Care Medical Evaluation
events.description: A clinical encounter where Epstein's medical history and current conditions (hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, back pain, neuralgia) were assessed, and a treatment plan including medication (Vascepa) was established.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Chest X-Ray
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Bureau of Prisons Medical Treatment Refusal form, declining a recommended routine chest X-ray.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Eye Doctor Evaluation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed multiple Bureau of Prisons Medical Treatment Refusal forms, declining recommended ophthalmologic evaluations.

events.title: Epstein Initial Dental Examination
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein underwent an initial Admission & Orientation dental examination at the MCC New York, conducted by dentist C. Ancrum.

events.title: Chronic Care Evaluation
events.description: Epstein is evaluated in chronic care clinic, reporting lack of medication, right arm numbness, and sleep issues due to missing CPAP machine. Multiple conditions are assessed and medications are ordered.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive and Resuscitation Attempt
events.description: At approximately 06:35, a body alarm is activated. Epstein is found unresponsive on his cell floor with CPR in progress by correctional officers. He shows signs of ligature marks. Resuscitation efforts continue, including intubation and medication administration, before he is transported to a local ER with CPR still in progress.

Health Services Unit (HSU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's detailed medical records from July-August 2019 document numerous chronic health conditions including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, prediabetes, low back pain, neuralgia, and constipation.
Epstein had a CPAP machine for sleep apnea which he reportedly had with him at the time of his arrest; the machine was logged into BOP property on July 30, 2019.
A medical transfer summary dated August 10, 2019, lists 'R/O self inflicted injuries' (Rule Out self-inflicted injuries) as a current health problem, indicating clinical concern.

Epstein was prescribed medications for pain (Medrol/MethylPREDNISolone), constipation (Bisacodyl, Magnesium Hydroxide, Docusate Sodium), and hypertriglyceridemia (Vascepa), and was monitored for blood glucose levels.
The records show he was cleared for food service but had a documented allergy to fish.

Jeffrey Epstein's detailed medical records from July 2019 show he was undergoing routine health assessments and treatment for conditions including constipation, hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, and low back pain while incarcerated.
Lab results from July 9, 2019, indicated elevated cholesterol (216 mg/dL), elevated triglycerides, low HDL, and slightly elevated liver enzymes (AST 57, ALT 62).
Epstein's medical history included chlamydia in 2015 (treated), chicken pox in childhood, and he reported 10+ female sexual partners in the last 5 years with inconsistent condom use.
A CPAP machine for sleep apnea was prescribed and set to be issued on July 30, 2019, with equipment details including serial number P11312813B1ED.
Epstein was assigned to a first-floor single cell with a lower bunk restriction and was not cleared for food service duties.
On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a rope around his neck, leading to his placement on suicide watch.
Epstein insinuated to medical staff that his cellmate was involved in the neck injury incident but refused to provide details, stating 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me.'
Epstein refused an optometrist evaluation on July 24, 2019, signing a formal treatment refusal form.
Medical records document Epstein reporting symptoms of neuropathy, including tingling in his right hand and a temporary loss of control in his right arm upon waking.
Lab tests from July 9-10, 2019, show Epstein's Hemoglobin A1C level was 6.3 (increased risk category) and HIV/STD screenings were negative.
Jeffrey Epstein had multiple chronic medical conditions including hyperlipidemia, obstructive sleep apnea, severe lower back pain (L4-L5 stenosis), and neuralgia at the time of his incarceration.
Epstein refused several recommended medical treatments from BOP staff, including a routine chest X-ray and eye doctor evaluations, signing official refusal forms acknowledging the risks.
Epstein reported that his CPAP machine for sleep apnea was with him when he was arrested and was likely in the possession of the FBI.
The medical records show Epstein was prescribed Vascepa (Omega-3) for hyperlipidemia and a Medrol dose pack for back pain.
Epstein underwent a routine dental examination on July 26, 2019, with findings of good oral hygiene and no urgent treatment priorities.
Jeffrey Epstein refused multiple recommended medical treatments in July 2019, including a chest X-ray and an eye doctor evaluation.
During a medical evaluation on July 30, 2019, Epstein reported right arm numbness, lack of his medications for a week, and an inability to sleep for three weeks due to not having his CPAP machine.
Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 10, 2019, at approximately 06:35.
The resuscitation report notes upon arrival, Epstein was 'cold, with circumferential ligature marks around the neck and posterior mottling. Pupils Fixed and dilated.'

Despite extensive resuscitation efforts, including CPR, intubation, and epinephrine, Epstein was transported to a local emergency room with CPR still in progress and in asystole (no cardiac activity).
